project_metadata.paper_title: Early contact between late farming and pastoralist societies in southeastern Europe
project_metadata.research_context: Ancient DNA study of 135 individuals from southeastern Europe and Black Sea region (5400-2400 BC) examining genetic contact between Copper Age farmers and steppe pastoralists.

evidence.evidence_text: Genome-wide data generated from 135 ancient individuals from contact zone spanning 5400-2400 BC
evidence.verbatim_quote: we analysed genome-wide data from 135 ancient individuals from the contact zone between southeastern Europe and the northwestern Black Sea region

evidence.evidence_text: Temporal distribution: 1 Neolithic, 95 Copper Age, 18 Eneolithic, 21 Early Bronze Age samples
evidence.verbatim_quote: Neolithic (n = 1), CA (n = 95), Eneolithic (n = 18) and EBA (n = 21)

evidence.evidence_text: Total skeletal material processed: 168 petrous bones and 129 teeth
evidence.verbatim_quote: We processed 168 petrous bones and 129 teeth in total

evidence.evidence_text: SNP panel used for enrichment: 1.24 million single-nucleotide polymorphisms
evidence.verbatim_quote: All samples were enriched for a panel of 1.24 million single-nucleotide polymorphisms (1,240,000 SNP panel)

evidence.evidence_text: Modern reference panel: 1,253 West Eurasians from 77 populations for PCA construction
evidence.verbatim_quote: principal component analysis (PCA) constructed from 1,253 modern-day West Eurasians from 77 different populations

evidence.evidence_text: SEE CA individuals from Yunatsite, Varna, Pietrele, Petko Karavelovo cluster together in PCA overlapping with Anatolian/SEE Neolithic groups
evidence.verbatim_quote: the chronologically younger SEE CA individuals from the emblematic sites of Yunatsite (YUN), Varna (VAR), Pietrele (PIE) and the multiple burial from Tell Petko Karavelovo (PTK), form a tight cluster that also overlaps with published Neolithic individuals from Anatolia and SEE

evidence.evidence_text: Outlier PIE060 displays shift toward WHG/EHG cluster on PCA
evidence.verbatim_quote: The outlier individual PIE060 is shifted further towards the WHG/EHG cluster in PCA, suggesting an excess of this type of ancestry

evidence.evidence_text: PIE060 qpAdm model: approximately 65% SEE Neolithic and 35% Iron Gates HG ancestry
evidence.verbatim_quote: Ancestry modelling with qpAdm supports a two-way model (Fig. 3d) with SEE N (around 65%) and Iron Gates HG or KO1 (around 35%) as the best proxies

evidence.evidence_text: PIE060 admixture date estimate: 16.3 ± 13.4 generations before mean 14C date
evidence.verbatim_quote: we obtained an admixture estimate of 16.3 ± 13.4 generations (Z = 1.213), which corresponds to around 81–832 years before the mean 14C date of PIE060

evidence.evidence_text: High Y-chromosome diversity at SEE CA sites: Pietrele (7 lineages/29 males), Varna (6/15), Yunatsite (4/6)
evidence.verbatim_quote: With seven different main lineages among 29 males in Pietrele (I2a1, C1a, G2a, H2, T1a, J2a and R1b-V88), six among 15 males in Varna (I2a1, I2a2, G2a, T1a, E1b1 and R1b-V88) and four among six males at Yunatsite (C1a, G2a, H2, J2a)

evidence.evidence_text: Kinship detection at SEE CA sites: 3 first-degree and 2 second-degree relationships total
evidence.verbatim_quote: we detected only three first-degree and two second-degree relationships in total

evidence.evidence_text: Ukraine Eneolithic samples (4500-3500 BC) form genetic cline between Neolithic/CA farmers and steppe Eneolithic groups in PCA
evidence.verbatim_quote: Eneolithic individuals from Ukraine (Ukraine Eneolithic), dated from around 4500–3500 bc, associated with the Cernavodă I and Usatove cultures, form a genetic cline in PCA space (Fig. 1b) between Neolithic/SEE CA individuals and published Eneolithic steppe individuals

evidence.evidence_text: Kartal site heterogeneity: five individuals (Kartal A) form cline toward steppe groups, three (Kartal B) cluster with Early Neolithic
evidence.verbatim_quote: Individuals from Kartal (around 4150–3400 bc), associated with the Cernavodă I culture, are genetically highly heterogeneous, with five individuals (Kartal A) forming a cline between 'Steppe Eneolithic'/'Steppe Maykop' individuals and Early Neolithic groups, while three other individuals (Kartal B) fall closer to the latter

evidence.evidence_text: qpAdm supports four-way admixture (Turkey_N, EHG, CHG, WHG) for KTL001, KTL007, MAJ, USV
evidence.verbatim_quote: Using distal qpAdm modelling we find support for a four-way admixture of Turkey_N, EHG, CHG and WHG for KTL001, KTL007, MAJ and USV

evidence.evidence_text: EBA individuals display two distinct genetic ancestry clusters in PCA
evidence.verbatim_quote: The EBA individuals in this study are characterized by two contrasting clusters of genetic ancestry in PCA space

evidence.evidence_text: YUN_EBA/PIE078 resemble SEE CA ancestry; BOY_EBA/MAJ_EBA fall in steppe ancestry cluster
evidence.verbatim_quote: Individuals from YUN and individual PIE078, who date to the first half of the third millennium BC, resemble the SEE CA groups, whereas BOY_EBA and MAJ_EBA individuals fall within the 'steppe ancestry' cluster

evidence.evidence_text: Y-chromosome contrast: YUN_EBA/PIE078 males carry I2a; BOY/MAJ_EBA males carry R1b-Z2103
evidence.verbatim_quote: the males from YUN_EBA/PIE078 carried Y-chromosome lineages I2a, suggestive of a HG legacy, while the males from BOY/MAJ_EBA carried R1b-Z2103 or derived lineages, a characteristic hallmark of Yamnaya-associated ancestry

evidence.evidence_text: 113 new radiocarbon dates reported
evidence.verbatim_quote: We also report 113 new radiocarbon dates

evidence.evidence_text: Radiocarbon dating: AMS at Curt-Engelhorn-Zentrum, calibrated via IntCal20/OxCal v.4.4.2
evidence.verbatim_quote: Radiocarbon dating was carried out using accelerated mass spectrometry at the Curt-Engelhorn-Zentrum Archäometrie gGmbH in Mannheim, Germany... All samples were calibrated on the basis of the IntCal20 database and using OxCal v.4.4.2

evidence.evidence_text: Extraction protocol: modified refs. 63,64 at MPI-EVA clean rooms
evidence.verbatim_quote: DNA was extracted from all samples following a modified protocol refs. 63,64

evidence.evidence_text: Library construction: partial UDG-half treatment for damage minimisation
evidence.verbatim_quote: DNA double-stranded libraries were built using a partial uracil-DNA-glycosylase (UDG-half) treatment

evidence.evidence_text: Screening: 5 million shotgun reads on HiSeq4000/NextSeq500
evidence.verbatim_quote: all indexed libraries were screened by means of shotgun sequencing of 5 million reads on an Illumina HiSeq4000 or NextSeq500 sequencing platform

evidence.evidence_text: Endogenous DNA threshold: 0.1% for enrichment eligibility
evidence.verbatim_quote: Libraries above the threshold of 0.1% endogenous DNA were enriched for around 1.2 million SNPs

evidence.evidence_text: Mean coverage achieved: 0.7x across enriched samples
evidence.verbatim_quote: resulting in a mean coverage of 0.7×

evidence.evidence_text: Mitochondrial contamination range: 0.086% to 9.2% via ContamMix
evidence.verbatim_quote: estimated contamination for both sexes on the mitochondrium using ContamMix (Supplementary Table A), ranging from 0.086% to −9.2%

evidence.evidence_text: Nuclear contamination for males: 0.2% to 2% via ANGSD
evidence.verbatim_quote: The nuclear contamination for males was estimated using ANGSD and ranged from 0.2% to 2%

evidence.evidence_text: PTK001 excluded: 18% contamination level disqualified from analysis
evidence.verbatim_quote: PTK001 yielded a contamination estimate of around 18% and therefore was excluded from all further analysis

evidence.evidence_text: f3 statistics confirm genetic homogeneity across SEE CA sites
evidence.verbatim_quote: outgroup f3 statistics suggest local genetic homogeneity throughout the CA in this region

evidence.evidence_text: No PC2-radiocarbon date correlation for Ukraine Eneolithic (Spearman's ρ = 0.113, P = 0.6656)
evidence.verbatim_quote: We tested for a correlation between positions of the Ukraine Eneolithic individuals in PC2 and their 14C dates and found none (Spearman's ρ = 0.113, P = 0.6656)

evidence.evidence_text: f4 statistics: Ukraine Eneolithic excess affinity to all HG groups vs Turkey_N (|Z| ≥ 3)
evidence.verbatim_quote: compared to Turkey_N, Ukraine Eneolithic individuals show excess affinity to all HG groups, as indicated by significantly negative f4 statistics (|Z| ≥ 3)

evidence.evidence_text: IBD analysis: fourth-sixth degree relationship between MAJ023 and USV006
evidence.verbatim_quote: we find a fourth to sixth degree relationship between MAJ023 and USV006, which reflects the close geographical vicinity of the two sites

evidence.evidence_text: ROH analysis: elevated parental background relatedness for MAJ and USV
evidence.verbatim_quote: in comparison to the preceding CA and heterogenous KTL individuals, ROH indicate a slightly elevated parental background relatedness for MAJ and USV

evidence.evidence_text: Data repository: European Nucleotide Archive accession PRJEB62503
evidence.verbatim_quote: The DNA sequences reported in this paper have been deposited in the European Nucleotide Archive under the accession number PRJEB62503

evidence.evidence_text: Funding: Max Planck Society and ERC grants (PALEoRIDER, ARCHCAUCASUS, FoodTransforms)
evidence.verbatim_quote: This research was funded by the Max Planck Society, the European Research Council under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement nos 771234-PALEoRIDER, W.H.; 834616-ARCHCAUCASUS, S.H.; and 678901-FoodTransforms, P.W.S.)

claims.claim_text: The study provides comprehensive genome-wide data from 135 ancient individuals across the critical contact zone
claims.verbatim_quote: we analysed genome-wide data from 135 ancient individuals from the contact zone between southeastern Europe and the northwestern Black Sea region spanning this critical time period

claims.claim_text: Genetic and cultural contact between farmers and steppe groups occurred approximately 1,000 years earlier than previously documented
claims.verbatim_quote: indicating genetic and cultural contact over a period of around 1,000 years earlier than anticipated

claims.claim_text: The dataset comprehensively samples four temporal periods from Neolithic through Early Bronze Age
claims.verbatim_quote: Neolithic (n = 1), CA (n = 95), Eneolithic (n = 18) and EBA (n = 21)

claims.claim_text: Extensive skeletal sampling from petrous bones and teeth enabled high-quality DNA extraction
claims.verbatim_quote: We processed 168 petrous bones and 129 teeth in total

claims.claim_text: The 1.24 million SNP enrichment panel provides adequate genomic resolution for population genetics
claims.verbatim_quote: All samples were enriched for a panel of 1.24 million single-nucleotide polymorphisms

claims.claim_text: PCA using 1,253 modern West Eurasians from 77 populations provides appropriate reference framework for ancient population projection
claims.verbatim_quote: principal component analysis (PCA) constructed from 1,253 modern-day West Eurasians from 77 different populations

claims.claim_text: Southeastern European Copper Age populations maintained genetic continuity with preceding Neolithic groups
claims.verbatim_quote: we observe genetic continuity between Neolithic and Copper Age groups from major sites in the same region

claims.claim_text: SEE CA individuals cluster genetically with Anatolian and SEE Neolithic populations
claims.verbatim_quote: form a tight cluster that also overlaps with published Neolithic individuals from Anatolia and SEE

claims.claim_text: Individual PIE060 represents an outlier with elevated hunter-gatherer ancestry
claims.verbatim_quote: The outlier individual PIE060 is shifted further towards the WHG/EHG cluster in PCA, suggesting an excess of this type of ancestry

claims.claim_text: PIE060 likely originated from a community outside Pietrele with recent HG contact
claims.verbatim_quote: A flat decay curve (Extended Data Fig. 3a) supports the interpretation of a recent admixture date, which suggests that PIE060 came from a community outside Pietrele with recent contact with HGs

claims.claim_text: Y-chromosomal diversity during SEE CA exceeded that documented in central/western Europe
claims.verbatim_quote: the Y-chromosomal diversity during the SEE CA was higher than in central/western Europe

claims.claim_text: Limited close genetic relationships detected within SEE CA burial sites
claims.verbatim_quote: we detected only three first-degree and two second-degree relationships in total

claims.claim_text: Ukraine Eneolithic populations represent admixture between CA farmer-related groups and steppe Eneolithic groups
claims.verbatim_quote: This indicates possible admixture between CA farmer-related groups and Eneolithic steppe groups, as in line with cultural interactions described in the archaeological record

claims.claim_text: The genetic cline reflects population dynamics over approximately 1,000-year span
claims.verbatim_quote: The observed genetic cline reflects developments over a wide chronological range of around 1,000 years

claims.claim_text: Kartal site exhibits genetic heterogeneity reflecting transformative dynamics of fourth millennium BC
claims.verbatim_quote: Individuals from Kartal (around 4150–3400 bc), associated with the Cernavodă I culture, are genetically highly heterogeneous

claims.claim_text: Four-way admixture model (Turkey_N, EHG, CHG, WHG) explains Ukraine Eneolithic genetic profiles
claims.verbatim_quote: Using distal qpAdm modelling we find support for a four-way admixture of Turkey_N, EHG, CHG and WHG

claims.claim_text: EBA populations exhibit two contrasting genetic ancestry profiles
claims.verbatim_quote: The EBA individuals in this study are characterized by two contrasting clusters of genetic ancestry in PCA space

claims.claim_text: EBA YUN/PIE078 individuals retain farmer-like ancestry while BOY/MAJ display steppe ancestry
claims.verbatim_quote: Individuals from YUN and individual PIE078, who date to the first half of the third millennium BC, resemble the SEE CA groups, whereas BOY_EBA and MAJ_EBA individuals fall within the 'steppe ancestry' cluster

claims.claim_text: Y-chromosome lineages distinguish local (I2a) from incoming (R1b-Z2103) EBA groups
claims.verbatim_quote: the males from YUN_EBA/PIE078 carried Y-chromosome lineages I2a, suggestive of a HG legacy, while the males from BOY/MAJ_EBA carried R1b-Z2103

claims.claim_text: 113 new radiocarbon dates provide robust chronological framework
claims.verbatim_quote: We also report 113 new radiocarbon dates

claims.claim_text: DNA extraction followed established modified protocols
claims.verbatim_quote: DNA was extracted from all samples following a modified protocol refs. 63,64

claims.claim_text: UDG-half treatment minimises ancient DNA damage artefacts
claims.verbatim_quote: DNA double-stranded libraries were built using a partial uracil-DNA-glycosylase (UDG-half) treatment

claims.claim_text: Initial shotgun screening identified samples meeting quality thresholds
claims.verbatim_quote: all indexed libraries were screened by means of shotgun sequencing of 5 million reads

claims.claim_text: 0.1% endogenous DNA threshold ensures adequate data quality for downstream analysis
claims.verbatim_quote: Libraries above the threshold of 0.1% endogenous DNA were enriched

claims.claim_text: 0.7x mean coverage sufficient for population genetics analyses
claims.verbatim_quote: resulting in a mean coverage of 0.7×

claims.claim_text: Low contamination rates across samples confirm data authenticity
claims.verbatim_quote: estimated contamination for both sexes on the mitochondrium using ContamMix (Supplementary Table A), ranging from 0.086% to −9.2%

claims.claim_text: High-contamination sample PTK001 appropriately excluded from analysis
claims.verbatim_quote: PTK001 yielded a contamination estimate of around 18% and therefore was excluded from all further analysis

claims.claim_text: Genetic cline not driven by temporal sampling bias
claims.verbatim_quote: We tested for a correlation between positions of the Ukraine Eneolithic individuals in PC2 and their 14C dates and found none

claims.claim_text: Ukraine Eneolithic exhibits excess HG affinity compared to Anatolian farmer reference
claims.verbatim_quote: compared to Turkey_N, Ukraine Eneolithic individuals show excess affinity to all HG groups

claims.claim_text: IBD evidence supports close geographic proximity interpretation for MAJ and USV sites
claims.verbatim_quote: we find a fourth to sixth degree relationship between MAJ023 and USV006, which reflects the close geographical vicinity of the two sites

claims.claim_text: Smaller effective population sizes characterised Usatove-associated groups
claims.verbatim_quote: ROH indicate a slightly elevated parental background relatedness for MAJ and USV... suggesting smaller effective population sizes in Usatove-associated groups

claims.claim_text: All sequence data publicly accessible via European Nucleotide Archive
claims.verbatim_quote: The DNA sequences reported in this paper have been deposited in the European Nucleotide Archive under the accession number PRJEB62503

claims.claim_text: Research received support from major international funding bodies
claims.verbatim_quote: This research was funded by the Max Planck Society, the European Research Council

claims.claim_text: Transfer of innovations during early contact integral to formation and expansion of pastoralist groups around 3300 BC
claims.verbatim_quote: We propose that the transfer of critical innovations between farmers and transitional foragers/herders from different ecogeographic zones during this early contact was integral to the formation, rise and expansion of pastoralist groups around 3300 bc

implicit_arguments.argument_text: Genetic patterns reliably reflect historical population movements and cultural interactions
trigger_text: we analysed genome-wide data from 135 ancient individuals
implicit_arguments.inference_reasoning: The study implicitly assumes genetic data can directly illuminate population dynamics and cultural exchange patterns. This foundational assumption underlies all interpretations linking observed genetic clines to migration and interaction histories.

implicit_arguments.argument_text: PCA clustering represents genuine demographic relationships
trigger_text: form a tight cluster that also overlaps with published Neolithic individuals
implicit_arguments.inference_reasoning: Interpretation of PCA clusters as reflecting demographic or genetic relatedness assumes clustering reflects biological reality rather than mathematical artefacts of the method.

implicit_arguments.argument_text: Modern reference populations appropriately capture ancient genetic variation
trigger_text: PCA constructed from 1,253 modern-day West Eurasians from 77 different populations, onto which data from the ancient individuals were projected
implicit_arguments.inference_reasoning: Projecting ancient samples onto modern PCA space assumes present-day genetic diversity encompasses relevant variation for interpreting ancient populations.

implicit_arguments.argument_text: Archaeological culture labels correspond to genetic population boundaries
trigger_text: associated with the Cernavodă I and Usatove cultures
associated with the Yamnaya cultural complex
implicit_arguments.inference_reasoning: Linking genetic findings to archaeological cultures assumes culture-genetic correspondence, though archaeological cultures and genetic populations may not perfectly align.

research_designs.design_text: Cross-sectional archaeogenetic survey spanning 3000-year period across farmer-pastoralist contact zones
research_designs.verbatim_quote: we analysed genome-wide data from 135 ancient individuals from the contact zone between southeastern Europe and the northwestern Black Sea region spanning this critical time period

research_designs.design_text: Multi-site comparative design contrasting genetic profiles across geographic and temporal contexts
research_designs.verbatim_quote: We compare these to Yamnaya-associated individuals from eastern Bulgaria, who were buried in mounds typically associated with steppe pastoralists during the third millennium BC

research_designs.design_text: Integrative multi-proxy genetic analysis combining autosomal, Y-chromosome, and mtDNA markers
research_designs.verbatim_quote: In line with the autosomal data, the Y-chromosomal and mitochondrial DNA lineages are common in nearly all Neolithic and CA groups studied

research_designs.design_text: Ancestry modelling design using qpAdm for formal hypothesis testing of admixture sources
research_designs.verbatim_quote: we formally tested the contribution of diverse ancestry sources using f4 (Steppe Eneolithic/Caucasus Eneolithic/Maykop, Ukraine Eneolithic; test, Mbuti)

methods.method_text: Ancient DNA extraction and library preparation from skeletal remains
methods.verbatim_quote: Ancient DNA work was carried out in dedicated clean room facilities of the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Anthropology (MPI-EVA), Leipzig and Jena, Germany

methods.method_text: Targeted SNP capture enrichment for genome-wide analysis
methods.verbatim_quote: Libraries above the threshold of 0.1% endogenous DNA were enriched for around 1.2 million SNPs in a targeted in-solution capture (1,240,000 SNP capture)

methods.method_text: Principal component analysis for population structure visualisation
methods.verbatim_quote: Principal components were computed for 1,253 present-day western Eurasians from 77 different populations (Supplementary Table B) on which data ancient individuals were projected
Outgroup f3 statistics were calculated using qp3Pop to obtain the genetic relatedness of a target population to a set of ancient Eurasian populations since the divergence from an African outgroup
Y-chromosome haplogroups for all male individuals were assigned using the manual assignment method of Y-haplogroup calling as described in ref. 70
HaploGrep2 (v.2.4.0; ref. 84) was used to assign each consensus sequence to a specific mitochondrial haplogroup
Ancestry modelling and ancestry proportion estimation on the 1,240,000 SNP dataset was performed using qpAdm in ADMIXTOOLS (v.5.1; ref. 4)
Genetic relatedness was estimated using READ, using default parameter settings
The software package HapROH (v.0.64) was used to analyse ROH on pseudohaploid 1,240,000 SNP capture data
IBD sharing analysis was done using ancIBD (v.0.4) on individuals with more than 600,000 SNPs
Radiocarbon dating was carried out using accelerated mass spectrometry at the Curt-Engelhorn-Zentrum Archäometrie gGmbH in Mannheim, Germany

methods.method_text: Ancient DNA authentication and quality control
methods.verbatim_quote: All libraries, except PTK001, yielded damage patterns characteristic of ancient DNA

protocols.verbatim_quote: Petrous bones were sampled with a minimal invasive method

protocols.protocol_text: Tooth sampling via crown separation and pulp chamber drilling
protocols.verbatim_quote: for the sampling of the teeth, the crown was separated from the root and the inner pulp chamber was drilled out
DNA double-stranded libraries were built using a partial uracil-DNA-glycosylase (UDG-half) treatment
all indexed libraries were screened by means of shotgun sequencing of 5 million reads on an Illumina HiSeq4000 or NextSeq500 sequencing platform
Libraries above the threshold of 0.1% endogenous DNA were enriched for around 1.2 million SNPs in a targeted in-solution capture

protocols.protocol_text: smartpca PCA with lsqproject and shrinkmode options
protocols.verbatim_quote: Principal components were computed for 1,253 present-day western Eurasians from 77 different populations... using the options 'lsqproject: YES' and 'shrinkmode: YES'
The f4 and f3 statistics were calculated using qpDstat and the f4mode: YES function... The f3 and f4 statistics were calculated using the ADMIXTOOLS package
Y-chromosome haplogroups for all male individuals were assigned using the manual assignment method of Y-haplogroup calling as described in ref. 70
HaploGrep2 (v.2.4.0; ref. 84) was used to assign each consensus sequence to a specific mitochondrial haplogroup

protocols.protocol_text: qpAdm distal modelling with cornerstone populations
protocols.verbatim_quote: The following groups were used as a basic set of outgroups for distal modelling: Mbuti.DG, Turkey_Epipaleolithic, Iran_GanjDareh_N, Russia_MA1_HG.SG, Russia_Kostenki14, Italy_North_Villabruna_HG

protocols.protocol_text: qpAdm proximal modelling with temporal/geographic source populations
protocols.verbatim_quote: Following up with proximal qpAdm models to explore potential contribution(s) of temporally and geographically closer groups

protocols.protocol_text: READ relatedness estimation with default parameters
protocols.verbatim_quote: Genetic relatedness was estimated using READ, using default parameter settings
The software package HapROH (v.0.64) was used to analyse ROH on pseudohaploid 1,240,000 SNP capture data. Only samples with more than 400,000 SNPs were included in the analysis

protocols.protocol_text: ancIBD v.0.4 analysis with 600,000 SNP threshold
protocols.verbatim_quote: IBD sharing analysis was done using ancIBD (v.0.4) on individuals with more than 600,000 SNPs and genotype probabilities > 0.99 after imputation

protocols.protocol_text: AMS dating with IntCal20/OxCal v.4.4.2 calibration
protocols.verbatim_quote: Radiocarbon dating was carried out using accelerated mass spectrometry at the Curt-Engelhorn-Zentrum Archäometrie gGmbH in Mannheim, Germany... All samples were calibrated on the basis of the IntCal20 database and using OxCal v.4.4.2
estimated contamination for both sexes on the mitochondrium using ContamMix

protocols.protocol_text: ANGSD nuclear contamination estimation for males
protocols.verbatim_quote: The nuclear contamination for males was estimated using ANGSD
EAGER v.1.92.56 (ref. 71) was used to process raw ancient DNA sequence data

protocols.protocol_text: BWA v.0.7.12 alignment to hs37d5 reference
protocols.verbatim_quote: reads were mapped to the human reference genome hs37d5 using BWA v.0.7.12
